key_questions_answered.1_user_types: End Users: New Investors, Active Traders, Passive Investors (robo-advisor), Fractional Share Investors, Tax-Aware Investors, Crypto Investors, Goal-Based Investors, ESG Investors, International Users, Kids Account Users, Premium Subscribers. Operational Users: Admin Dashboard Users, Manual Verification Queue Operators, Compliance Officers, Support Staff, Human Advisors, Operations Staff. System/Technical Users: Risk Engine, Settlement Batch Jobs, Monitoring Dashboards, Analytics System. External System Users: Custodian Platforms (DriveWealth/Alpaca), Bank Rails (Plaid/Flinks), Market Data Providers, ID Verification Providers, Compliance Systems, Notification Services. Regulatory/Compliance Stakeholders: FINRA/IIROC, Auditors, Legal Team.
key_questions_answered.2_key_goals: End Users: Quick onboarding (3-minute goal), Invest in stocks/ETFs with fractional shares, Manage portfolios with auto-investing, Use robo-advisor for managed portfolios, Track performance and receive alerts. Admin/Operations: Review and approve KYC documents, Monitor suspicious activity, Freeze accounts for fraud/risk, Reconcile trades daily. Compliance: Ensure CIP/AML/OFAC compliance, Track regulatory notifications, Maintain audit logs, Generate tax forms (T5, T3, 1099, 8949).
key_questions_answered.3_primary_stakeholders: Direct Users: Individual Retail Investors, Parents (kids accounts), Premium Subscribers. Internal Operational: Admin/Operations Team, Compliance Team, Support Team, Product Team, Engineering Team, Security Team, Analytics Team. External Integration Partners: Custodian Partners (DriveWealth/Alpaca), Banking Partners (Plaid/Flinks), Market Data Vendors, ID Verification Vendors, Compliance Service Providers. Regulatory Bodies: FINRA (US), IIROC (Canada), Tax Authorities (IRS/CRA), Securities Regulators. Future/Edge Case: Joint Account Holders, Corporate Account Users, Account Beneficiaries, International Users Moving Countries, Social Investing Users. Internal Testing/Development: QA/Testing Team, Penetration Testers, Data Warehouse Team.
key_questions_answered.4_first_thing_users_do: Onboard and start investing in 3 minutes - includes ID verification, KYC, account setup, and initial funding.
key_questions_answered.5_problems_eliminated: Onboarding: Slow traditional onboarding, abandonment issues, complex KYC, OAuth limitations, multi-country complexity. Investment Access: High minimum investments, complex account types, limited asset classes, no auto-investing. Trading: Commission fees, poor order execution visibility, limited order types, no fractional shares, delayed market data. Portfolio Management: Manual cost basis tracking, no performance benchmarking, manual rebalancing, no tax-loss harvesting, dividend reinvestment confusion. Funding: Slow ACH (1-5 days), no instant deposits, failed ACH handling, FX conversion complexity, funding limits. Tax & Compliance: Manual tax form generation, compliance complexity, regulatory notification management, audit log requirements. Security: Account fraud, device trust, 2FA enforcement. Support: Complex support processes, no self-service options.
key_questions_answered.6_struggles_delays: Onboarding abandonment - users don't finish setup (need partial state saving). KYC verification delays - manual document review queues. Funding delays - ACH takes 1-5 days, instant deposit requires risk engine. Regulatory complexity - compliance requirements slow down features. Trade execution delays - settlement takes time. Tax form generation - complex multi-region requirements.
key_questions_answered.7_systems_integrations: Custodian platforms (DriveWealth, Alpaca, or custom) - asset custody, trade execution. Bank rails (Plaid, Flinks, or custom) - ACH funding, bank linking. Market data providers - real-time/delayed quotes, candlestick data. ID verification providers - KYC document scanning and verification. Compliance systems - CIP, AML, OFAC checks. Notification services - email, push, SMS. Tax form generation systems - T5, T3, 1099, 8949.
key_questions_answered.8_integration_behaviors: Funding flow: Bank → Plaid/Flinks → ACH → Custodian → Account balance. Trading flow: User order → Risk engine → Custodian → Execution → Settlement → Portfolio update. KYC flow: Document scan → ID verification provider → Compliance checks → Account approval. Settlement: Daily batch jobs reconcile trades between platform and custodian. Compliance: Real-time AML/OFAC checks on deposits and trades, flagging suspicious activity.

evidence_provided.Technical specifications: Infrastructure notes mention microservices (or modular monolith for MVP), services (auth, user profile, payments, trading, portfolio, analytics, notifications), real-time events (Kafka or cheaper alternative), API gateway with throttling, DR environment, nightly batch jobs, data warehouse separate from transactional DB, monitoring dashboards.
evidence_provided.Similar systems: References to WealthSimple as inspiration for onboarding animations, user-friendly UI, robo-advisor approach.
evidence_provided.Business model: Subscription model considerations (Wealth Pro $10/month), commission-free trading with FX markup, potential $2/month for accounts under $1k, transparent fee breakdown, crypto spread charges, margin interest (future).

additional_questions_answered.Future considerations: Crypto support (optional but architecture should allow), joint accounts (phase 10), kids accounts with allowance investing, ESG filters, AI portfolio assistant, multilingual support, premium tier with video calls, social investing (regulatory concerns), bucket visualization for goals, corporate accounts (probably never), account beneficiaries (long-term).
